result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Omar Fuentes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Omar Fuentes in court.  Attorney Rebecca M Coffee in court for Omar Fuentes.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed but not acted upon. Judge Conen (Branch 13) spun plea/sentencing hearing to Judge Davila (Branch 1) which accepted.

Defendant Omar Fuentes in court.  Attorney Rebecca M Coffee in court for Omar Fuentes.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea - received and filed
Elements of the Offense/WIS JI - Criminal
Deferred Prosecution Agreement - received and filed

Defendant Omar Fuentes in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Omar Fuentes appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in DPA posture. Defense counsel informed the Court defendant has a TAD evaluation scheduled for 08/01/2022.   DPA Hearing adjourned to Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Omar Fuentes in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Omar Fuentes appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Rebecca M Coffee in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense counsel asks that defendant's appearance be waived, granted. Defense advises the Court she was just retained yesterday and asks for an adjournment to allow time to meet with client. 
Defense further advises they have received discovery but are awaiting an offer. 
Court orders matter adjourned back to Branch 37. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 046885,
Payable Number: 1006538,
Receipt Number: 22RP019499,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Omar Fuentes
Current: 825 South 20th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 04-13-2022)
Prior: 824 South 20th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant Omar Fuentes in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/13/22 @ 1:30p
